documents.document: When they write the biography for David Cameron, will they put "PM who ran a million miles from Brexit", or "Wise sage who foresaw Trump"?
Sometime next year, someone will publish "TRUMP: THE FIRST 100 DAYS" and it'll need 18 fricken volumes.
@gj_robins looks like I didn't need the word "have" in that tweet.
@ezbear This is all so, so terrible.

@ShakingStick I mean, I appreciate he's probably sick of all the grief he's getting, but it would have been so easily avoided. Remarkable.
@dbseymour Are you saying it's not worthwhile for political leaders to take a moral stand on an issue if there is little practical effect?
Hey @pmbillenglish and @dbseymour, I'd settle for even a retweet of this: https://t.co/fybppXH0IF
@DeeMickSee at least. I hear the crowd went all the way back to the Basin Reserve.

Trump: HAHAHA HUMAN RIGHTS

@roddrury Right to make him a permanent resident. But citizenship requires a stricter test; article misleading. https://t.co/m8rSINLOVI
That's... brilliant. https://t.co/PpRUDjBoNg
@Nikki_Macdonald It's on front page of print version. But yeah, I wouldn't have remembered it was on but for that!
@GraemeEdgeler That might well be the case (find out soon, I suppose). Original point is that Eric misstates the test.
@GraemeEdgeler Usual/unusual isn't the test.
For the record, I don’t care about or oppose Thiel’s political views. I care about whether the Minister followed the law. /end
That question shows how quickly this becomes political. And therefore it’s a stringent test, which the Min may have interpreted wrongly. 3/
Many of Eric's arguments would also apply to, say, Trump if he invested in NZ. Would we want to grant him NZ citizenship? 2/
This is misleading. The test is whether it is in "the public interest because of exceptional circumstances".… https://t.co/aQT6CjePFy
@ShakingStick oh, sorry, yes. Misread your tweets as 'OIO Act'.
Hey @pmbillenglish - the "public interest" ground only applies in "exceptional circumstances". What were they? https://t.co/SF1Fn7rNeu

It's great that Peter Thiel spent millions investing in NZ. That's why he was a permanent resident.
Now, why does he get citizenship?
@cjsbishop *All* questionable grants of citizenship ought to be carefully scrutinised.
I've been going to Nam'd so often they now ask if I want the 'usual'. #lifegoals
@drdeanknight Great work, Dean - that was excellent.
